```{r, message = FALSE}
# Load libraries
library(tidyverse)
library(ggplot2)
library(stringr)
source("helper.R")
```

```{r}
# Read master survey file generated for analysis
raw_data <- read.csv("data/master.csv", stringsAsFactors = FALSE)
```

```{r}
# Define the text from the desired column as 'q'. Select the data as 'q_data'. Generate the question n, or # of unique respondents as 'q_n'
q <- "What.is.your.current.level.of.pain..where.0.is.no.pain.and.10.is.the.worst.pain.imaginable..what.is.your.current.level.of.pain."

q_data <- get_single_selection_0(data = raw_data, q.name = q)

q_n <- length(unique(q_data$id))
```

```{r}
# Generate plottable data as 'q_plot'
q_plot <-
  q_data %>%
  group_by(response) %>%
  summarize(count = n()) %>%
  mutate(percent_responded = round(100*(count / q_n), 2)) %>%
  arrange(desc(count))
```

```{r}
# Plot the question data as 'r'
r <- 
  ggplot(q_plot, aes(x = reorder(response, count), y = percent_responded)) +
  geom_bar(stat = 'identity') +
  coord_flip() +
  geom_text(aes(label= paste(round(percent_responded, 0), count, sep = "%:"))) +
  xlab("Response") +
  ylab("% Responded, Count") +
  labs(title = "What is your current level of pain (where 0 is no pain and 10 is the worst pain imaginable) what is your current level of pain?", subtitle = q_n)
r
```

```{r}
# Save graph as PNG, plot data as csv, and all question data including response IDs as csv (change # at end of plot file to question n or q_n)
ggsave(filename = 'q8_current_pain.png', plot = r, device = 'png')

write.csv(q_plot, 'q8_current_pain_217.csv', row.names = FALSE)

write.csv(q_data, 'q8_current_pain_ids.csv', row.names = FALSE)
```
